intro: Ilex sideroxyloides var. occidentalis, commonly known as the western holly, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Aquifoliaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, elliptical leaves that turn red in the fall. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in the spring, which are followed by red, fleshy berries that are an important food source for birds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or arid habitats. Its botanical features make it a valuable plant for ecological restoration and ornamental gardening.
